snippet: The attorney general said the Justice Department would investigate whether the police in Ferguson, Mo., mistreated motorists or suspects in the years before the Michael Brown shooting.
abstract: Attorney Gen Eric H Holder Jr says Justice Department's investigation into police department in Ferguson, Mo, will focus on racial profiling; inquiry, coming on heels of police shooting of teenager Michael Brown, will look into whether officers made discriminatory traffic stops, mistreated prisoners or used excessive force in years before fatal shooting.

byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez contributed reporting from Ferguson, Mo.

lead_paragraph: The attorney general said the Justice Department would investigate whether the police in Ferguson, Mo., mistreated motorists or suspects in the years before the Michael Brown shooting.

headline.main: Federal Inquiry of Ferguson Police Will Include Apparent Racial Profiling
headline.print_headline: Federal Inquiry of Ferguson Police Will Include Apparent Racial Profiling
